q: made", Mr Donald Rumsfeld wrote. In a lengthy section on the treatment of wartime detainees, Mr Donald Rumsfeld regrets not leaving office in May 2004, after the Abu Ghraib prison scandal erupted. Looking back, I see there are things the administration could have done differently and better with respect to wartime detention, he acknowledges.

amount of material," Howard Stern said in an interview for CNN's " Piers Morgan Tonight." Howard Stern went on to say that Jay Leno is "not fit to scrub David Letterman 's feet." I don't know how he's beaten David Letterman in the ratings, he said. "It's beyond my comprehension. America must be filled with morons who at night lay in bed-- the ones who are watching him, they must be in a coma."

SHOW with DAVID LETTERMAN," MONDAY, FEB. 7( Aaron Rodgers walks out onstage as CBS Orchestra plays "We Are the Champions," and audience gives him a standing ovation) David Letterman : We were talking a little bit about your itinerary for today. Under any circumstances, it would be grueling, but especially after winning the Super Bowl, MVP, and all of the traveling, thank you, thank you very much for the trouble.( audience applauds) Aaron Rodgers : "No, this is fun for me. I mean, this is-- I watch your show a lot." David Letterman : "I appreciate that.

In a strong attack on the City, Mr Michael Gove said bank bosses had paid themselves "astronomical" sums and appear to me to be living in a parallel universe to the rest of us. "The sense of contrition for what went wrong in the banking crisis seems to be invisible," he added. "The banks have to show they get it." He said

Some engineers seem to be drawn by the work at a smaller company, which offers an opportunity to reshape culture with less corporate bureaucracy and more creative freedom. Facebook has become the cool kid on the block, and now Google Inc. wants to prove it can still be cool, too, said Danny Sullivan , who follows both companies closely as editor-in-chief of Search Engine Land.
